Reviews.Title: Simply amazing television
Reviews.Author: A. Siegel
Reviews.Content: As my title says this TV is simply amazing. I actually was debating on whether to purchase this 40" LED 3D 1080p 120hz Samsung TV (UN40EH6030) or a practically identical 40" LED 1080p 120hz Samsung TV (UN40EH6000). At the time of purchase the 6030 was selling for $497.99 which has 3D capability and also comes with a pair of 3D glasses.  The 6000 was selling for $548.00. They both have the same exact specifications, except that the 6030 has 3D capability which is the only difference and I even called Amazon to confirm this, as sometimes things aren't 100% accurately described. The Amazon rep confirmed that they were basically the same TV. Don't believe me? Look it up for yourself and compare specs. So I got a 3D TV instead of just a regular 2D TV AND SAVED $50 which is awesome. To seal the deal I didn't have to wait in line for this deal, didn't have to worry about getting trampled, and it was delivered to my home 2 days before Black Friday.Took about 10-15 minutes to assemble (very easy assembly) and another couple minutes to make a few minor tweaks to the picture. I actually used a review from the UN40EH6000 reviews to help make the minor picture tweaks. If you decide to purchase this TV i'd direct you to follow that review to change some settings as they made the TV look even better. The review is titled "Sometimes...Not BEING a Smart TV... is The SMART TV!" and it's posted by F. Maria.I am a big gamer, and playing Halo 4 and Call of Duty Black Ops 2 and to say the picture is great is an understatement. So clear, so crisp, the blacks are black, whites are white, as they should be. I'm going to begin my military service here in the next few months so it'll likely be idle for at least 6 months so if you're looking for a updated review i'm sad to say you likely won't see one, but rest assured that if something goes wrong with my television I will do my best to update my review as soon as possible so that you and others researching this TV are given timely information.Was a bit skeptical when purchasing through Amazon as usually with electronics you want to see it with your own eyes, but the process couldn't have really gone any better, unless they decided to give me a free TV :)Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Take it from an owner, this television IS 120hz... Pay no attention to the other reviewers!
Reviews.Author: Jantzen
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make a review only for the fact that there are two misleading reviews already!  This TV is 120hz.  Period.  People should not always believe what others post based on a hunch.  The reason people think this is a 60hz TV..?  Because the manual says "120hz Panel Refresh Rate (in 3D mode)."  That's all they're going off of.  What it should really say is "120hz Panel Refresh Rate (in 3D mode, too)."All Samsung TV's with a CMR 240 are guaranteed 120hz in ALL modes.  The 60hz version of this TV is the Samsung 40eh5000.  That TV is not available in 3D because 60hz 3D is not a realistic option.  Images would be too hazy.  This is a Samsung 40eh6030.  I hope I have made myself clear that this is in fact a 120hz TV.  A simple call to Samsung will confirm that.Now for the actual TV.The picture quality is great.  Although it does not get quite as bright as some LED TV's I have seen, it's certainly bright enough.  (I also own the Sony Bravia XBR55HX929, ya know, the $3500 one... It may not be fair to compare them.)  The images are crisp and clean.  The dynamic contrast ratio of 5,000,000:1 gives images an impressive black level.3D.  The 2D to 3D conversion is only decent.  It's preferable just to watch the content in its native 2D.  However, when you get your hands on native 3D content with a 3D blu-ray player,  The 3D is absolutely immersive.  It looks fantastic.  The glasses are somewhat cheap and uncomfortable after a long time, though.  Native 3D gaming is also a whole new experience that just blew my mind.Sound quality.  The sound leaves a bit to be desired.  The TV can definitely pump enough volume for the average living room but to get a full experience, you may want to consider external speakers.Final thoughts.  The TV is a fantastic set... If you were lucky enough to pick one up on black friday for $499 then you should definitely keep it!  You won't find a better deal for quite awhile.  Personally, I'm not into the whole 'smart TV' trend because they make many boxes that can do the same for much cheaper.  If you like that stuff, you will be sorely disappointed.  One of my favorite things about this TV is that there are quite a few ways to customize the picture... More than my Sony even.All in all, I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: this is a great LED TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "vivgor"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the set from another retailer as I got a better deal. I am writing this review to present the facts as I see them. I am no videophile or guru, so please regard my review only as an end user perspective.Pros-1. Excellent picture quality. I have seen 480p, 720p and 1080p channels on this set and without doubt it is as good as the best television sets the stores put up for display.2. Sounds great. 20W does the magic I suppose. Previously I thought Sony Bravia was best at video and audio, but this tv blows it to dust.3. IT DOES NOT FEEL THICK. If you are worried about the thickness of the TV, please refer to other LED sizes. You will be surprised to see that most of them in this class are above 3 inches. This one is 3.7 inch thick, and to me, what matters most is how thick it feels. It does not.4. 120 HzCons-1. I feel the 3D quality is not that great when converted from 2D. I will update the review when I get chance to watch real 3D content.2. When I plug it in the contrast was set to 100. Holy crap. I was so worried. I brought it down to a good level and then started noticing how great the picture looked.

Reviews.Title: Picture great.  Background static is driving me nuts.
Reviews.Author: wshin
Reviews.Content: Got it at Best Buy yesterday.  Set up was fine.  Picture is great.  Our other TV is a plasma & I like the difference. After set up there was a low static sound coming from the back of the set.  Went online to find out about the humming/static. Apparently this must happen alot.  Said tv needs to be serviced.  Great timing.  Won't even be able to get to a rep at Best Buy until ... hopefully sometime Saturday. Not going the service route.  Replacement sounds better.  Anyone else have this problem?

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, but beware of the 120hz spec
Reviews.Author: Awaizy
Reviews.Content: First of all, the TV is amazing. It's great for 360, blurays, and PC usage. I experience no input lag when connecting to my PC to play some FPS games. The PC mode is excellent and I believe it supports 4:4:4 mode for 1 to 1 pixel mapping. The thing with this TV Is that retalers are advertsiing that it is a 120hz set. This is only partially correct. The 120hz only applies to the fact that it can do 3D, but the set does not support Auto Motion Plus to smooth out the image. One downside is that there are only 2 HDMI inputs, which can be a problem if you have a lot of devices to connect. Otherwise, excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly Poor Customer Service *Revised 5/24/13*
Reviews.Author: Burton Kellogg
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV in 11/2012. We loved the quality of the picture & features. In late April 2013, a grey smudge 1/2 the size of a dime appeared in the center of the screen. I submitted an online repair request with Samsung on 5/2. After nineteen days, six e-mails, several phone calls, two repair services, a visit from a tech, three conversations with 'Executive Customer Relations', two different 'ticket' numbers and one review by the mysterious 'Panel Review Board', I've been advised that they will not repair our TV, and that there is no recourse.Why? They're claiming physical damage, even thought there's not a mark on it. Someone poked it with a finger, they say. My wife is 60; I'm 62. There have been no other people in our home since 2/2013 other than the Samsung tech. And we're not prone to poking our fingers into TV screens. An interned search of this problem indicates a blown led/lcd, but Samsung won't discuss it. We're stuck, and that's it.Btw, no one at Samsung knows what is going on. The evening of the day the Tech was here, I received a call from Samsung asking if I was happy with the repair. The day the repair service called and told me that my repair was denied (5/17), I called Samsung and was told that my complaint would be sent to the 'Panel Review Board' and that I would be contacted by Samsung within 24 hours with a decision. So I waited. On 5/21, Samsung called me and asked if the 'Executive Customer Relations' people had called me back. I said no, I was still waiting. She advised me to call them, stating 'They won't call you'. So I did, and was told of our fate by a nice lady who had no inkling what was going on. And she told me that I could not talk with the 'Panel Review Board', because they could not contact them! She also refused to forward me to a supervisor.Bottom line: Samsung will sell you a defective product and refuse to repair it. They'll snow you with e-mails, meaningless conversations, and hope that you'll become so frustrated going in circles that you'll give up. In our case, the message is clear;:'It's not a big problem. Better learn to live with it, because we're not going to fix it'.Learn from this, people. Don't buy Samsung.Addendum: Today, 5/24/13, I received a very pleasant phone call and an email from a representative of the President of Samsung. They're going to replace the screen on our TV. She also apologized for the treatment we received. As I said, we loved the TV, but did not appreciate the problem we had with Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Snoopy
Reviews.Content: This is a review for the TV. This is not a review about the shipping service from Amazon or their customer service like many other reviewers get into.First of all, if you bought the TV while it was on sale at many retailers during November and December of 2012, and paid about $590 for it, it was the best deal that you could have gotten for a 3D TV. The picture quality of this set is great when compared to other 1080p sets within the price range of $500 to $900. The menu and set up of this set was fairly easy to handle. There are 2 HDMI inputs, audio output via 3.5mm jack, 1 Ethernet input, 1 USB input and other RCA inputs for video. Although this TV has the ability to connect to the internet, it does not have the many Samsung apps that other models have. Nevertheless, you may see some 3D previous and short videos in 3D through a Samsung interface that is already installed on this TV when you connect it to the InternetThe picture quality is very good for TV that is under $900. The 3D capability is pretty good. I already watched several 3D movies and the TV gave a very nice picture. The TV also has 2D to 3D option, which is okay. This conversion is not great since it is obvious that 2D content was not filmed in 3D. Therefore, do not expect 2D content look like a 3D movie that was filmed for 3D format.The sound is okay, it is good enough for this TV. If you really want to experience the 3D experience, you would need to connect an external receiver and speakers.Overall the TV is very good for the price. Even if you end up paying up to $850, it is still worth the price. That is, unless you find a better deal on the Samsung 40" slim model for a better price.

Reviews.Title: Constant defective audio
Reviews.Author: Eric Tang
Reviews.Content: The only reason I give it 2 stars is because I have been able to see some movies, approximately 7 movies during the 2 month period that I have owned this T.V. At the beginning probably after watching 2 movies the sound gave out completely, no audio whatsoever. Audio still comes out from the RCA connections but who still uses them? Everything is HDMI, and the audio from none of the 2 HDMI outlets worked. Samsung and their techs took approximately 2 weeks to fix the problem. 2 weeks later the same problem occurred, this time I was disappointed and didn't want to go through the hassle of having the tech come again and who knows it might give the same problem again later. So I checked with Amazon to see if I can return the T.V. I couldn't anymore since I was 3 days passed the "return window". Now I just have to hope that the audio doesn't consistently stop working for me to wait 2 weeks for Samsung to fix it. And hopefully it doesn't stop working after the 1 year warranty period.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 3D LED TV for this price!!!!
Reviews.Author: Anand
Reviews.Content: It got this one for $497 during Thanks Giving.  So far so good.  Watching Blu-ray movies is excellent experience.  I will recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: 3d blast
Reviews.Author: Joe Venable
Reviews.Content: Could not be better pleased with pic but sound needs some tweaking. I would buy again but add sound bar

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: Carmen Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I love it. Everything works perfectly. The 3D looks amazing, the sound and quality is extremely good. Very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: DrewHasty
Reviews.Content: Best TV for the price.  The 3D is excellent.  Picture is great.  Sound is good.  Couldn't have bought a better TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 3d
Reviews.Author: Hobie
Reviews.Content: Great tv with good color and black levels. 3d works well and love being able to turn any 2d image to 3d.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture, good sound and reasonable 3D!
Reviews.Author: RAF
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN40EH6030 provides a surprisingly good 120hz picture with good sound (not Dolby 7.1, but better than most LED TV's that I've had) and an added bonus, 3D tv. I was amazed given that this unit was $50 cheaper than the equivalent 2D Samsung.  Not sure why it only cost $499 as I enjoy a crisp, clear, fragment free 2D picture that handles action without distortion (in both sports and blueray movies).  The 3D works beautifully as well although the glasses that came with it are insubstantial (lightweight, but easily broken).  I've rated this unit with 5 stars because it provides all you need in a 40 inch LED with the added bonus of 3D.  I couldn't be happier with its performance.  My next set will be a UHD as and when the units become readily available, the broadcast technology and movie technology catches up, and the prices come down.The weaknesses of the TV are mainly focused on the inputs - only two HDMI slots and a standard 3 plug AV input.  But, I've solved that problem with an automatic HDMI switch that uses one input and moves between an XBox 360 and PS3, the other HDMI slot used for HD digital cable input.  If you want more HDMI slots, you'll pay dearly for them in more advanced models.All in all, a great purchase offering significantly more value than other brands/units with equivalent capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture quality; good value for money
Reviews.Author: ennar
Reviews.Content: We've had it for about 2 weeks now and very happy with the purchase so far. Considered various options (Samsung, LG, Panasonic, Vizio) before settling in for this one. Seemed like a great buy (1080p, 120Hz, 3D) @ $499. Picture quality is gorgeous (although one might argue its a little too bright right out of the box). As some other reviewers have noted, would be best to find one of the many posts online with picture settings recommendations (e.g. check out avsforum.com). The 3D picture looks amazing. Sound is ok (I have mine routed to a receiver anyways). We didn't care for a smartTV (and this isn't one). It does have an ethernet (RJ45) port for those that may care.I was a little nervous ordering a large electronics item through Amazon. But it worked out quite well. Smooth ordering process and fast shipping. Overall, seems like great value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Javier Durango
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV, so I cannot compare it to other products. I think it should have more input connections and sound is not that good, so Im going to buy a soundbar later. Beside that, I think picture is clear, 3D looks great and the price is unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: My first 3dtv got to be a Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Alex "jazz rocker"
Reviews.Content: For many years I've have Sony Tv's at home, and the quality & durability is the most important feature from Sony.But after a year and a half doing my homework, visiting Best Buy, Sears, and CompUSA, I decided to take advantage of the Samsung specials previous this Black Friday,So.... Bingo I got it !After 2 weeks playing with my new Toy, I can say that for the price It is a Super Bargain, The Image is super clear.The Hd box VIP722k DVR from Dish network had been upgraded with this super Tv (1080i @ 60HZ):  5 STARSThe Blu ray image 2d and 2d to 3d with my old Samsung BD P1200 Batman, Dark Knight, Inmortals, (1080p @24 fps): 5 STARSThe TEST for Hd TOSHIBA HD-D3 2d and 2d to 3d with Transformer 1 and The Scorpion King (1080i@ 60hz)  4.5 STARSThe TEST for 3d blu ray SAMSUNG BD D5500 3d to 3d with Men in Black 3 (1080p @24fps @ 10Gbps cable ):  not 5 but 6 STARSHowever It has one litle problem: only 2 hdmi inputs:  2 stars.Conclusion: The Best that you can find for you money ......Buy it...

Reviews.Title: Good video quality and 3D moves are great! Sound sucks [especially woofer]
Reviews.Author: Hari Govardhanam
Reviews.Content: I have been using this TV for couple of months. Video quality is really good. 3D movies look exactly like they do in theatre.Sound quality is one thing that I am really disappointed about. I don't know if its a problem with my unit or if its the TV itself but music doesn't sound right. Especially woofers feel like they are blowing air [a bit too loudly] rather than making any sound. You might have to use other speakers because the TV speakers definitely won't please you. Also, TV isn't loud enough. It's hard to listen to dialogs even when you increase sound level to 40-45.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Morrow
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV last week to replace my 7 year old 720p Samsung DLP.  What a HUGE difference! The black level on this TV is simply amazing and the clarity is excellent. ( I am reviewing the 46" model--UN46EH6030-- as there did not seem to be a place to do so, but all features are identical to the 40" model ). I must admit I was a bit confused as to the actual refresh rate of this TV as it is marketed as a 120Hz but the box has the 240 CMR logo on it.  After some digging, what this essentially means is that through complex algorithms taking place in the guts of the TV, the actual refresh rate--while 120Hz--appears much higher ( i.e. 240Hz like ).  I have since watched NFL games, some high-speed chase scenes and the opening space battle sequence of Revenge of the Sith with no visible lag or pixellation noticeable. The picture is --in a word--awesome.  I also fired up the PS3 and played a few games; again, no visible lag.  So for those worried that the refresh rate might not be good enough, don't worry, it is ( and I have a keen eye for these things and was ready to take it back if it didn't pass muster ).  Also, the amount of "picture tweaking" within the menus is quite impressive, with A LOT of settings going far beyond contrast, brightness, sharpness and the like. In fact, there are two menus available for picture tweaking that have things I am unfamiliar with so for those wondering if this TV can be calibrated I'd say "definitely".  The 3D is pretty cool and will even convert 2D sources to 3D. Some source material is better than others but the fact that the TV even does it is pretty impressive. This TV does NOT have Wi-fi built in ( didn't need a smart TV as I have my PS3 ) but you can buy a USB wireless dongle if you need one for updates and things ( the TV does have an ethernet port ). The remote is great in that it actually LIGHTS UP so you can see the keys in the dark !! All in all, a great value for the $799 price tag.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy for the Price
Reviews.Author: Mohammad N. Qamar
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from other retailer and i must say that i just love this TV. When i went to buy it i was bit confused that how come such a TV with so many features is listed for just $497 where as same TV without many feature was listed for more then $500. I confirmed with the rep of that retailer store and his response was "YOU ARE BUYING A RIGHT TV AT A RIGHT TIME".When i brought this TV home it only took me 20 min to fix it.....very simple to setup. Secondly, the picture quality and the sound system is just awesome. It has a LAN connection aswell so that you may connect it to your network with your router (this LAN option was something i wasnt aware of it, so i was bit surprised when i saw it). 3d function is also great !in simple words i would say that this is a very good TV and i would recommend buying.

Reviews.Title: Sound and Video do not Synch
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these on Black Friday. After using for about a month I exchanged it because the sound and video was not synching. It was like I was watching a dubbed Kung Fu movie with the TV people's lips not synching with the sounds. I used an HDMI that goes directly from the TV to the Direct TV Box so there are no other components involved. Eventually I exchanged it for a new one. Same problem. I can't believe more people haven't written about this issue. I am going to buy a sound bar and plug it directly into by directv box and see if that solves the problem.Otherwise the TV is good for the price. I also wonder if it is really 120 Hz as advertised. Doesn't seem to be. The 3-D is awesome though.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture but some problems on fast action
Reviews.Author: qlehenaff
Reviews.Content: Really nice image for the price ; still when action is fast, the image is not sharp.I used to have a Philips before and it was better. But more expensive.One bad point is the lack of HDMI connection (2 only)Good TV however.

Reviews.Title: beautiful
Reviews.Author: Jessica L Stemple
Reviews.Content: The screen is fantastic and has a bunch of differnet settings including the fact that this can or can not be 3d which is glorious since I hate 3d - it comes with the glasses too. I prefer the bright setting although it can and will react with the light in the room if you set it up like that. which is nifty.

Reviews.Title: Buy this TV
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Absolutely ridiculous piece of technology. I purchased this tv almost exactly a year ago. It'll be a year go this Sunday. This tv is incredible. The picture just blows me away. Everything is crisp and beautiful. The 3D is really cool. Playing My old PS3 on it was a great experience. Now playing my PS4 will be even better. Buy this TV! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV untill it starts turning on and off... Problems!!!
Reviews.Author: Abhi
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV (Samsung UN40EH6030FXZA) last year in November and was very happy that I got just the right TV for me... I did not need any smart features. Just a TV to watch shows and play Xbox.Everything was fine (other than 3D which I didn't quite like) until about a month ago when the problems and issues started ... TV just wouldn't turn on.Tried both the remote control and the actual power button on the TV but nothing. The small red LED at the bottom of the TV just blinked on and off. (I actually have a video recording of it)So I submit a request at the Samsung support website (Remember my TV is less than a year old so very much in the warranty). They assign the request to one of their contracted repair shops.But there is a surprise ... The TV decides to turn itself ON. Nobody was trying to turn it on. Remote was not touched. Suddenly it starts on its own accord.So the technician comes over... replaces the Power Supply since he cannot see any error code and that is all he can think of.Couple of weeks go by fine and again the same thing.... And I am doing the same thing again calling the support. This time the support guy replaces the Power Supply AND the Main Board.A week goes by and AGAINNNN the same thing.And here is the best part - the technician who came by says he cannot find the problem.So this time I call up Samsung support. Spend almost the whole day trying to reach their "Executive of Customer Relations" who flat out tells me that they will NOT replace my TV since "Cannot find the problem" does not mean "There is a Problem".She offers to send another technician over.. like that is going to help.I believe the UN40EH6000 also has the same issues since these are closely similar TVs.Right now I am really disappointed with Samsung customer support. The TV was actually pretty good until all this started. I strongly recommend everyone to remain as far away as possible from Samsung TVs.

Reviews.Title: Sent two back but finally found one that works
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: When I first bought this tv I was very frustrated. I sat down, turned it on and saw a beautiful dead pixel right in the center of the screen. I was forced to drive all the way back to Costco and return it. Decided to try it again. Came home and set up my second unit. Not before long the screen started to blink every 2 to 20 seconds randomly.I also noticed on both units that there was a significant audio lag on certain channels. Most notably on AMC. I even read the forums and set the delay to 100 and still had trouble. Lastly, there was a lot of pixellation on fast scenes. I wasn't sure if it was my Rogers next box or the tv doing this. I figured that Costco probably had a bad batch of them. I went to futureshop and picked up my third tv (the same of the two I picked up at Costco) and I made one change. Swapped my next box for and older hd unit 8300hd. I also calibrated the unit using the settings i found online and modified them a bit to fit my room further. Worked perfectly!!! No ghosting, no audio delay. The unit looks fantastic.Toronto, Ontario

Reviews.Title: Mild ghosting, but overall a pretty good deal.
Reviews.Author: Sergio Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was going to stray away from purchasing this because of the lack of HDMI inputs (there are only two), but I found that so far that isn't a huge deal breaker for me. The amount of configuration needed to get a better-than-out-of-the-box picture isn't too bad, and that's without touching the granular white balance settings Samsung offers*. I don't believe I received any dead/stuck pixels, but I swore I saw one when I was watching SportsCenter, but I have since not seen it. I really doubt it was Fios, or maybe I wanted to see one. In any case, the picture quality is good and there is minimal ghosting, but I have seen it on shows like Archer though it is not bad enough to warrant the whole ordeal of attempting to return this.Overall, a pretty good purchase if you want to purchase from a major brand name.* If you want a good starting point, go here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R1YKDGGEK5DXQRTL;DRNO 3.5mm output2 HDMI portsSmall amounts of ghostingEnough white balance options to appease a photographer

Reviews.Title: Good Quality TV from Samsung, Watching 3D at Home is a gr8 exp. My family is enjoying!
Reviews.Author: Niranjan Muzumdar
Reviews.Content: 3D movies with Samsung active glasses is a awsome experience.Samsung Blu-ray 3D SMART home theater to enjoy the sound and 3D theater exp..Thanks Samsung. Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Not 120Hz, but still good.
Reviews.Author: Caddyroyalty
Reviews.Content: Picked this up on black friday 2012. Bought this UN40EH6030 over the UN40EH6000 which was a bit more. I thought I was getting the same 120hz that the 6000 offered and was also getting 3D. Turns out that the 120hz is only for 3D mode and its 60hz is 2D, its right there in the spec sheet [...]The picture is great. Its thick because its direct lit, not edge lit which I like, not much vignetting. Blacks are black and colors are vivid.The only question is do I return it and opt for the UN40EH5000 to get some money back, or return it and spend a little more to get UN40EH6000 which is really 120Hz.

Reviews.Title: Returned it
Reviews.Author: Hubster
Reviews.Content: *Update*Changed from 3 to 1 star.  The TV started not turning on right away.  The red power light would blink with every click of the remote, but it wouldn't turn on with either the TV or satellite remote.  Research shows the issue is likely due to bad capaciters.  Further proof of cheaper components in this model of TV.  I had one day left in my return period and I took advanage of it.  Amazon was great in providing a prompt refund.*End of Update*We had previously purchased the UN40EH6000 earlier in 2012.  I assumed (wrongly) that this would essentially be the same TV except cheaper (I got the black Friday deal) and with 3D.I don't know if this is 120hz or 60hz.  I've seen logical arguments on both sides.  I do know the UN40EH6000 is 120hz and I think it has the better picture.  That's not to say the picture on this model is horrible.  I think it's very good - just not as good as the UN40EH6000.The main problem I have with this TV is after a few weeks we noticed the sound wasn't matching up with the lips of people talking.  We were running HDMI cords directly from the TV to the Dish receiver - no external speakers or soundbar to cause issues.  After much reasearch and trial and error, we narrowed the problem down to the TV itself.  Our satellite installer said he had seen the same issue - usually on cheaper TVs, like RCA - and was surprised it was happening on a Samsung.  He said changing from HDMI cords to Component video usually fixed the problem so we did that and the issue is resolved.  I think Samsung installed inferior parts on this model (and hid the ball on the 120 vs. 60 issue which makes me lean toward it's a 60) in order to put out a cheap 3D black Friday model that would sell well.All that stated, I can live with the TV as the picture is very good (I'd probably give it a solid 4 stars but for the lip syncing issue), but this purchase has put a black mark on Samsung in my mind and I'll be wary before purchasing another product of theirs.  If you want a 40 inch with the same dimenions and can live without the 3D, then I recommend getting the UN40EH6000.

Reviews.Title: Not quite right
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I've tried to stay optimistic throughout these past 2 months of owning this TV, I was hoping that this TV would last me for many years, but I know I will only be able to withstand the defect of the picture for so long.The main issue is that you can see the LED array grid in the picture. Any scenes where it is dark or low lighting brings out the LED grid, I've played with the settings for hours trying to get it to go away. The best comprimise is bringing the backlight setting to about half power and increasing the brightness and contrast to compensate, so you get a less vivid picture that's a bit more grainy that it should be, like a camera with the ISO setting too high. Seeing that damn LED array grid in the background was just driving me nuts, so this is what I'll have to do to get by.Secondly, the sound is abismal. I would say catastrophically bad. It's one thing to have low volume limits or poor sound depth, but this TV outright ruins the sound by vibrating upon itself and distorting at even medium volume levels. You will NEED a theater sound system for this TV, unless you plan on watching C-SPAN with the sound low or subtitles.If I didn't get this TV for a black friday steal, then I would have given Samsung an earful and gone through the hassle of returning it.

Reviews.Title: Not as good picture quality as my Sammy LCD.
Reviews.Author: brel1600
Reviews.Content: I had High hopes and  expectations for this TV. Unfortunately, I felt extremely letdown. I have an older 40 inch Samsung LCD that, In comparison, The 55  looked horrible! I ended up sending this TV set back.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung
Reviews.Author: Sassycat
Reviews.Content: Just another addition to our Samsung family, I love this tv. Samsung makes wonderful products. This is great size and great price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Sless
Reviews.Content: 3D works great when you are watching a 3D movie, otherwise its just average. Picture quality is awesome, and the Samsung Allshare is GREAT! My wife and I have Samsung Galaxy Tab and a Galaxy Note 10.1, with a baby on the way this is a great way to take video on our phones or tablets and then wireless beam it to the TV. I tested this out right away and it works PERFECT! Cant go wrong with this TV! There is a USB Wi-Fi adapter you can but to download content on this TV, for only $35 bucks well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Not 120hz as advertized, average picture quality
Reviews.Author: Andrey Zubkov
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be very, very clear: this TV is not 120 hz. How do I know? I've probably seen close to 100 different 120/240hz models in operation, and have also seen a fair share of 60hz sets over the years. The CMR 240 is a software trick to try and smooth the picture, but in the end the picture doesn't have that sharp 120 hz look. This is funny, because the TV is billed as a 120 hz on every website (except for Samsung).Other thoughts:- Decent picture quality at best, definitely not as vivid as other Samsung sets. I tried many settings published on various forums, and even when calibrated the picture is "just ok".- When turning on the CMR feature in the options, it does nothing but dim the screen- Sound quality is ok, it works well, no funny noises or anything like that- The 55" set cost me $950 on BF, so the price was very fair- Having two HDMI ports is annoying, but there are many HDMI splitters out there that'll do a wonderful job- The physical TV set itself looks very nice, it's got a thin bezel and isn't as deep as I thought it would be- The 3D looks great, comes with two pairs, extra no-frills glasses are only $20 eachUnfortunately, I was really, really looking forward to having a 120hz set at home. This was the primary reason I bought this particular TV and I'm still extremely disappointed and feel lied to. I'll probably never buy another Samsung product due to this. Hence, the 2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Beyond expectation..
Reviews.Author: Premanand Pandi
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with this purchase. I bought it in black friday sale .... With that price i got and Full HD LED TV with 240 motion rate, it is good deal. But i was not much confident on the clarity part.... But when we got the product and we were boned away with amazing picture quality .. Sound is also much better than expected... Only minus is it has only 2 HDMI ports ... Everything else is good. Last but not least it also has  3D functionality ..

Reviews.Title: No screws
Reviews.Author: christopher langston
Reviews.Content: TV came without screws for the stand, I had to jerry rig it, it doesn't look good. I bought this on black fri, but was overseas and opened it when i got home a few days ago. kinda pissed!

Reviews.Title: Maybe older technology works better?
Reviews.Author: Fritz "Fritz"
Reviews.Content: The sound died on my blu-ray to flatscreen after 3 weeks. I contacted the tech subport and they blame it on the HDMI cable but still didn't work with a new HDMI cable. I replaced the blu-ray player and still no sound but there was plenty of sound from cheap dvd playes and videotape machines. I only wish there was one sourse of tech support that could figure this out. So far I'm less than happy but don't have the time to endlessly go from one company to another to figure this out. I almost wish I had my 21 inch analog tv back.

Reviews.Title: fanastic led quality and 3d too
Reviews.Author: Harold Ginsburg
Reviews.Content: hellothe samsung tv that i bought from amazon has by far the sharpest and most vivid color i have ever seen on a tv set. i am using my samsung c6800 3d blu ray player to get all the apps i need through the tv

Reviews.Title: Does what a HD digital TV is supposed to do.
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy set up, very good sound and great price.Haven't tried the 3D feature yet.Have cable but no box from the cable company.  Stations come in at their off air channel numbers  57-1, 57-2, 40-1  etc.  Nice feature since stations with multiple broadcasts are grouped together.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful television!
Reviews.Author: PhillyJoe
Reviews.Content: Finally decided to upgrade from our 32" Westinghouse we've had for the last 6+ years, it was a great TV that never gave us a problem.  This TV blows it out if the water.  Amazing deal at $499 and well worth the $700+ I have seen it sell for recently.  Everything works as expected and in many cases expectations were exceeded.  I highly recommend for anyone who isn't a total tech nerd who just wants a great TV that does what it should.  The 3D aspect was not needed, but I have been greatly impressed by the feature.Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good not great
Reviews.Author: S. Cohen
Reviews.Content: I thought I was buying a 40" Samsung on a par with the the other LED Samsung Tvs that I've purchased. For starter's it is considerably thicker than  the other Samsung LED's that I've purchased. The picture while decent is not exemplary as I've come to expect. It's construction and features make it clearly manufactured for a cheaper market.The picture is very good, but not on a par with the higher end Samsung TV's

Reviews.Title: Good tv...
Reviews.Author: bob "bob"
Reviews.Content: I have to write this review because I fell victim to dishonest marketing. I purchased the 55es6030 tv on the 23rd and was very happy until I read the other readers review about the 60ghz 2d and 3D being 120ghz. I like to confirm my facts so I did reach out to Samsung and they did confirm that it's only 120ghz in 3D. If that is not a deal breaker I'm sure this tv will be great for someone else not for me! Still love Samsung !

Reviews.Title: Bad quality all around
Reviews.Author: Lucas A.
Reviews.Content: Just bought this TV to use mainly for my PS3 and watch movies.If it didn't say so in the box, I'd swear this is an LCD TV and not LED. The picture quiality is subpar and the screen is very dark, not very bright as most LEDs. Out of the box, it looks terrible. After some playing with the settings, it improved a bit, but not enough. You can't do much in this aspect.Now, for the real problem... ghosting and input lag. You can't play video games with this TV, the ghosting is intolerable and there is a slight input lag. There is a "Game Mode" in the settings, but it degrades pictuare quality and smoothness a lot.Just so you can imagine how bad this TV is, my 23" LED monitor looks 10 times better, and there is no ghosting or input lag. Not a little bit.2D TV is also problematic. It's clearly that 2D is 60hz (maybe even 50hz) and not 120hz as most people (and Samsung) believe.2D to 3D conversion is very poor. Haven't tested 3D, and won't, because after all these things, I just stored it, waiting to exchange it for a Sony.Don't buy it if you like movies, HD TV and gaming. It's a terrible TV.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Zahn
Reviews.Content: I think Samsung make a great TV.  I like this one very much, but was a little dissappointed finding out the 3D doesn't work on all movies.

Reviews.Title: TV is great but delivered damaged
Reviews.Author: Thomas Seiger
Reviews.Content: TV came with a big cut in the top of the box and when I pulled the TV out it had a crack in the plastic. I did not want to go through the procees of trying to return it and it seems to work ok. Problem is electronics and getting banged around dosn't mix. Wish I would have gone to a local store.

Reviews.Title: Article not received,
Reviews.Author: ULISES ARGUELLO SALGADO
Reviews.Content: Article not received, have poor performance in large shipments because the company that sent the package did not deliver. buy whenever I sent to the same address and have not had any problems.
